title: old Action Man logo (60s)
content:
looking for the lowercase "a" in man. Is this an alternate character for the eurostile font from the 60s? or a different font?

for some reason I can't attach the image as a jpg of a gif
author: flex

comments.content:
"for some reason I can’t attach the image as a jpg of a gif"

You should propably install [Flash Player 8](http://web.archive.org/www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer)

[http://www.barkingshins.com/am/wanted/paraleaf01.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415204640/http:/www.barkingshins.com/am/wanted/paraleaf01.jpg "http://www.barkingshins.com/am/wanted/paraleaf01.jpg")

Image here, more Helvetica Compressed than Eurostile, but not quite.  
Tim

what about this one?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415204640im_/http:/typophile.com/files/am_move.jpg)

or this one?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415204640im_/http:/typophile.com/files/am_thefight.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415204640im_/http:/typophile.com/files/actionman-logo-scan2.jpg)

"Move him into ACTION POSITIONS" is various weights of Univers. The other two are hand-drawn.

- Lex

'Grotesque' / ' [Bureau Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415204640/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/BureauGrotesque)' may be an alternate for 'the movable fighting man'.

Dav
